channel.title: Need Administrative assistance
channel.description:
I'm completely new to this forums and currently am not sure where to post this thread so if it is the wrong place then please move it without hesistation, sorry if I cause any distraught.
Regarding the title, I have a single concern. I currently just switched VPS hosts for my server in hopes to require better service, specifically uptime. On the host I am unable to login because it says I am banned and therefor am unable to even access registering and other simple tasks. The ban is also not set to expire. I can honestly say myself that I was not the one that got the IP banned, it is a managed VPS so I assume someone on the same host had been ip banned for reasons unknown. That being said I understand that unbanning the Ip would be dangerous because potentially this could be harmful, I only request you look at the situation and see if it's possible to Unipban, otherwise I will have to request a host migration. I am looking to remove my current advertisement and completely start fresh but I am unable to do so without being able to login. I can obviously ask my provider to do a host change, I have asked but they don't seem to be responding, even thought it's only been 2 hours I wan't this done as soon as possible and I didn't see any other way of getting this done without contacting these forum administrators. I also only switched providers yesterday and I don't see them doing a host change this early into the service and it would also be very inconvenient to myself.
[size=12pt]TL;DR[/size] My VPS is ipbaned, I cannot register from it. I was not the reason. I am requesting being unipbanned and also an advertisement cancellation/removal. Is this possible?
Note: If you need any proof that I have not even visisted the Moparscape.org/smf forums from my host then I am sure I can figure out some way to get the track record. Thank you very much if you reply, the assistance is muchly appreciated.

item.title: Need Administrative assistance
item.dc:creator: @Veldahar Veldahar
item.description:
@Veldahar wrote:

Thank you, I just did. I truly appreciate the feedback.

Read full topic
